thread.title: After Harry Wilson becomes Jurgen Klopp's 19th Liverpool debutant, we look at who could be No.20?
thread.title_full: After Harry Wilson becomes Jurgen Klopp's 19th Liverpool debutant, we look at who could be No.20?

author: irishmirror
title: After Harry Wilson becomes Jurgen Klopp's 19th Liverpool debutant, we look at who could be No.20?
text:
Sport After Harry Wilson becomes Jurgen Klopp's 19th Liverpool debutant, we look at who could be No.20? Wilson came on for 25 minutes at Plymouth to be the 19th player blooded in the first team in the 15 months since Klopp arrived Share Harry Wilson is the 19th player to debut for Liverpool under Jurgen Klopp (Photo: Liverpool via Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A Wednesday night at Plymouth may not be a glamour fixture for most Liverpool players but it's one Harry Wilson won't forget. 
The 19-year-old became the 19th player to make his debut under Jurgen Klopp in the Reds' 1-0 win over the League Two outfit. 
Wilson's full international debut for Wales came in October 2013, but he had to wait until this week for his first-team Liverpool bow. 
And he did it in style, replacing Brazilian star Philippe Coutinho for the last 25 minutes at Home Park. 
So that's 19 debuts in 15 months for Klopp, 12 of them young players who were at the club when the German arrived. 
Here's who the Reds boss has blooded so far and five of the brightest sparks at the club who could be next. Harry Wilson watches as the ball goes over the bar after coming off the bench on Wednesday (Photo: Reuters) Five who could be Klopp's 20th debutant? Rhian Brewster Rhian Brewster is among Liverpool's vibrant striker stocks (Photo: Nick Taylor/Liverpool FC) 
The 17-year-old striker was, alongside 'keeper Kamil Grabara, Liverpool U18's brightest player in their 3-1 FA Youth Cup defeat at Manchester City on Wednesday. Despite being starved of service for much of the game, he ran hard with and without the ball and scored a brilliant goal. He was the quickest to react to Okera Simmonds' low cross, firing past Aro Muric to haul Liverpool level shortly after the half-hour mark. The striker joined the Reds at the age of 15 and he has already represented England U17s. Conor Masterson Conor Masterson leads the Liverpool side out ahead of Wednesday's FA Youth Cup clash with Man City (Photo: Liverpool via Getty) 
Republic of Ireland youth international defender was the man chosen to take over U18s captaincy duties this season when the above mentioned Trent Alexander-Arnold rose to the U23s. Already on the first-team radar, he was an unused member of the FA Cup bench at Exeter City, where a host of Klopp's young guns first appeared at St James Park. Paulo Alves Paulo Alves was on the bench at Plymouth but wasn't used (Photo: Liverpool via Getty) 
It seems like a matter of time for this teenager, who was an unused substitute for the Red's 1-0 win at Plymouth on Wednesday night. He hails from Cristiano Ronaldo's childhood stomping ground, Madeira in Portugal, and arrived at Anfield from Porto during the summer of 2015. Alves, sometimes referred to as Paulinio, turned 19 on Christmas Day and has already had a taste of senior football with Sanjoanense in the Portuguese third tier. Bobby Adekanye Bobby Adekanye came to Liverpool from Barcelona via Ajax (Photo: Liverpool via Getty) 
The Nigerian-born Dutch youth international came to Anfield with some serious pedigree - cutting his teeth at Ajax and then Barcelona before a year on loan at PSV Einhoven ahead of the move to Liverpool. A sharp left winger, Adekanye told the Liverpool Echo last year that he models his game on Bayern Munich's Arjen Robben. “Arjen Robben,” he said. “I’ve always liked his style and I try to play like him. He’s exciting and makes football a joy to watch." Brooks Lennon (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) 
A rare American talent in the Premier League ranks, Lennon is being linked to a return to Real Salt Lake, the club from which Liverpool signed him in the MLS. A loan deal would of course delay any start for the Reds, but a call on his future would show how he's regarded at Anfield - it could be permanent with the US club keen to enlist local talent. Danny Ings return from injury has limited his time in the U23s but he's impressed when given the chance. The 19 who've debuted under Klopp 
1. Connor Randall 
7 appearances in total. Debut vs Bournemouth, Capital One Cup, October 28, 2015 (Photo: Liverpool via Getty) 
1 appearance against Exeter City, FA Cup, January 8, 2016 (Photo: Liverpool via Getty) 
3 appearances. Debut vs Exeter City, FA Cup, January 8, 2016 (Photo: Nick Taylor/Liverpool FC) 
1 appearance against Exeter City, FA Cup, January 8, 2016 Ryan Kent of Liverpool gets past Connor Jennings of Tranmere (Photo: Getty) 
5. Kevin Stewart 
20 appearances. Debut vs Exeter City, FA Cup, January 8, 2016 (Photo: Getty) 
13 appearances. against Exeter City, FA Cup, January 8, 2016 (Photo: PA) 
4 appearances. Debut vs Arsenal in the Premier League, January 13, 2016 (Photo: Liverpool via Getty) 
2 appearances. Debut vs Bournemouth, Premier League, April 17, 2016 Joshua King has his shot saved by Danny Ward (Photo: Reuters) 
9. Sergi Canos 
1 appearance vs West Brom, Premier League, May 15, 2016 ST HELENS, ENGLAND - AUGUST 9: (THE SUN OUT, THE SUN ON SUNDAY OUT) Sergi Canos of Liverpool and Jake Clarke-Salter of Chelsea in action during the Liverpool v Chelsea U21 Premier League game at Langtree Park on August 9, 2015 in St Helens, England. (Photo by Nick Taylor/Liverpool FC via Getty Images) (Photo: Nick Taylor/Liverpool FC) 
10. Gini Wijnaldum 
24 appearances. Debut vs Arsenal, August 16, 2016 LIVERPOOL, ENGLAND - DECEMBER 31: (THE SUN OUT, THE SUN ON SUNDAY OUT) Georginio Wijnaldum of Liverpool scores and celebrates the first during the Premier League match between Liverpool and Manchester City at Anfield on December 31, 2016 in Liverpool, England. (Photo by Andrew Powell/Liverpool FC via Getty Images) (Photo: Liverpool via Getty) 
11. Sadio Mane 
21 appearances. Debut vs Arsenal, Premier League, August 14, 2016 (Photo: John Powell) 
15 appearances. Debut vs Arsenal, Premier League, August 14, 2016 (Photo: Tom Purslow) 
13. Marko Grujic 
5 appearances. Debut vs Burnley, Premier League, August 20, 2016 DERBY, ENGLAND - SEPTEMBER 20: Marko Grujic of Liverpool passes during the EFL Cup Third Round match between Derby County and Liverpool at iPro Stadium on September 20, 2016 in Derby, England. (Photo by Richard Heathcote/Getty Images) (Photo: Getty) 
14. Joel Matip 
14 appearances. Debut vs Burton, EFL Cup, August 23, 2016 (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) 
15. Loris Karius 
14 appearances. Debut vs Derby, FL Cup, September 20, 2016 (Photo: PA) 
7 appearances. Debut vs Derby, FL Cup, September 20, 2016 (Photo: Andrew Powell) 
6 appearances. Debut vs Tottenham, EFL Cup, October 25, 2016 (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) 
18. Ben Woodburn 
4 appearances. Debut vs Sunderland, November 26, 2016 (Photo: Getty) 
1 appearance. Debut vs Plymouth Argyle, FA Cup January 18, 2017 poll loading Which Liverpool player will be next to make their debut under Jurgen Klopp? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
